There are $n$ junctions connected by $n-1$ roads, forming a tree.  

$m$ suits will appear at different times ($t_i$) at different junctions ($v_i$) and travel to other junctions ($u_i$) at a constant speed ($c_i$).  

Each suit travels along the shortest path between its starting and ending junctions.  

Determine the first time two suits occupy the same location (junction or on a road) simultaneously. If this never happens, output -1.

You are given a tree with nodes and edges. Each edge has a weight.  There are also objects that move along the edges at different speeds. Each object starts at a node at a specific time and travels to another node along the shortest path. If two objects occupy the same node at the same time, an explosion occurs. Find the time of the first explosion, or -1 if there are no explosions.
